qas.question: What is the name for the smaller streams along the region northern Germany?
The smaller streams are used for what?

answers.text: draining the surrounding land and polders
for draining the surrounding land and polders

qas.question: What is the name of the old north branch of the Rhine?
What is the translation of the old north branch of rhe Rhine?
What part of the Rhine flows west at Katwijk?
What name is used only for larger streams farther to the north?
What streams continue to carry water from the Rhine?
What is the the old south branch of the Rhine called?
When the Rhine took a right turn what did it create?
During what ages were the Limes Germanicus built?

context: The name <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2><b5_0><b6_0>Rijn<b6_0/><b5_0/><a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/>, from here on, is used only for smaller streams farther to the north, which together formed the main river Rhine in Roman times. Though they retained the name, these streams no longer carry water from the Rhine, but are used <a1_2>for <a1_0><a1_1>draining the surrounding land<a1_0/> and polders<a1_2/><a1_1/>. From Wijk bij Duurstede, the old north branch of the Rhine is called <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2><b7_0>Kromme Rijn<b7_0/><a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/> ("<a3_0><a3_1><a3_2>Bent Rhine<a3_2/><a3_1/><a3_0/>") past Utrecht, first Leidse Rijn ("Rhine of Leiden") and then, <a4_1><a4_2>Oude Rijn<a4_2/><a4_1/> ("<a4_0>Old Rhine<a4_0/>"). The latter flows west into a sluice at Katwijk, where its waters can be discharged into the North Sea. This branch once formed the line along which the Limes Germanicus were built. During periods of lower sea levels within the various <b9_0>ice ages<b9_0/>, the Rhine took a left turn, creating the <b8_0>Channel River<b8_0/>, the course of which now lies below the English Channel.
